java.rmi
Interface Remote

public interface Remote

The Remote interface serves to identify interfaces whose methods may be invoked from a non-local virtual machine. Any object that is a remote object MUST directly or indirectly implement this interface. Only those methods specified in a remote interface, that is, an interface that extends java.rmi.Remote, are available remotely.

Implementation classes can implement any number of remote interfaces and can extend other remote implementation classes.

Since:
JDK1.1
